articles.title: Message of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Premier
articles.content:
Message of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Premier
Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il, Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Kim Yong Il, premier of the Cabinet, Tuesday received a message of thanks from Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
					 The message said:
					
					 I and my party have already successfully wrapped up our official goodwill visit to the DPRK, a friendly neighbor of China.
					
					 Before leaving your country, I would like to express our heartfelt thanks to you for your warm hospitality and minute organization.
					
					 During the visit, we witnessed the beautiful scenery of the DPRK and saw for ourselves the admirable successes achieved by the Korean people in the cause of socialist construction under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by you General Secretary Kim Jong Il and could feel warm and deep feelings of the Korean people toward the Chinese people.
					
					 We reached wide-ranging common understanding through a frank and in-depth exchange of views on the matter of the Sino-DPRK relations and international and regional issues of common concern.
					
					 The visit helped further deepen the mutual understanding and trust between the two sides and promote the exchange and cooperation in various fields of the two countries.
					
					 We are satisfied over the success made by our visit.
					
					 We wish the DPRK prosperity and its people happiness.
					
					 We wish General Secretary Kim Jong Il, President Kim Yong Nam and Premier Kim Yong Il good health and successes in your work.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Visits Farm
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Visits Farm
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of China, and his party visited the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Cooperative Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, on Tuesday.
					 Accompanying them were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 After being briefed on the fact that Thaekam has gone through radical changes under the care of the peerlessly great persons, Wen Jiabao went round the house visited by President Kim Il Sung together with Premier Zhou Enlai, a room dedicated to the history of DPRK-China friendship and a kindergarten.
					
					 He donated vehicles to the farm.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Leaves
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Leaves
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, left here by special plane on Tuesday after paying an official goodwill visit to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at the invitation of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government.
					 Leaving with Wen Jiabao were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members.
					
					 Present at the airport to see them off were Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Yong Ho, chief secretary of the Cabinet Secretariat, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials, Chinese guests staying in the DPRK and Chinese students studying here.
					
					 A farewell ceremony took place at the airport.
					
					 A woman of the Chinese embassy and members of the Korean Children's Union presented bouquets to Wen Jiabao.
					
					 Wen was cordially seen off by Pyongyang citizens along the streets of the city.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine of the People's Republic of China.
					 Wang Yong, minister of the administration who visited the DPRK, conveyed the gift to an official concerned.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The basket and letter were handed over to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, by Mats Foyer, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK who is doyen of the corps, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Party Founding Museum
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Party Founding Museum
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano and his embassy officials Tuesday visited the Party Founding Museum on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 They went round the historical data and mementoes on display, being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung founded the WPK right after the liberation of the country on the basis of the firm organizational and ideological foundation for founding the party and brilliant revolutionary traditions he provided in the crucible of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and developed the WPK into a revolutionary and mass party which struck its roots among the broad popular masses.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the ambassador wrote in the visitor's book that Kim Il Sung founded the WPK and energetically worked to unite all the Korean people, thereby building a socialist system on this land. The ambassador paid high tribute to him.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior led by its chief Viktor Yeliseev, and a delegation of the Workers' Party of Mexico headed by Leobardo Alcantara Martinez, member of its National Executive Committee and director of the party training institution, arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Joint Friendly Meeting of Korean and Chinese Youth Held
articles.content:
Joint Friendly Meeting of Korean and Chinese Youth Held
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- A joint friendly meeting of Korean and Chinese youth took place at the Central Youth Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present there were members of the Chinese youth friendship delegation led by Lu Hao, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said in his speech at the meeting that the DPRK-China friendship President Kim Il Sung provided together with revolutionaries of the elder generation of China continues to favorably develop under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Hu Jintao.
					
					 He called on the youth organizations and youth of the two countries to boost the friendly exchange and cooperation.
					
					 Lu Hao hoped that the people and youth of the DPRK would register great success in socialist construction under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The Chinese youth would dynamically advance toward the future, further developing China-DPRK friendship with the Korean youth. Then a performance was given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and young artistes of China.
					
					 The DPRK performers presented colorful numbers including chorus "Our General Is the Best" and mixed quartet "The Blue Sky over My Country".
					
					 Also staged were Chinese songs including chorus "Let's Sing of the Motherland" and male solo and pangchang "Song of One". 
					
					 Young Chinese artistes put on the stage several pieces including solo and chorus "I and My Motherland" and male solo "Song of Grass-covered Plain".
					
					 They impressively sang Korean songs including mixed duet "Arirang" and female quartet "When Spring Comes Every Year".
					
					 At the end of the performance the youth of the two countries held merry dancing party to the tune of cheerful music.

articles.title: Posters Released
articles.content:
Posters Released
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Posters encouraging the working people to win a victory in the 100-day campaign were produced by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
					 Poster "All for the 100-day campaign!" depicts a worker calling upon all the people to the all-out charge, firmly holding the red flag bearing letters "a great prosperous and powerful nation."
					
					 Another poster "Let us successfully conclude the drive for this year through the vigorous 100-day campaign!" shows the Songun Chollima leaping on four hooves to soar and a worker holding his iron fist high.
					
					 It strongly calls for displaying the spirit of devoted implementation and demonstrating once again the spirit and mettle of heroic Korea on all fronts.

articles.title: Album Put out in Commemoration of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and China
articles.content:
Album Put out in Commemoration of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and China
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Languages Publishing House of the DPRK has of late brought out an album titled "DPRK-China Friendship Lasts Century after Century" in commemoration of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					The album gives historical photographs on the traditional DPRK-China friendship which was pioneered by President Kim Il Sung, Chairman Mao Zedong and veteran revolutionaries of China and is being developed in depth by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and President Hu Jintao.
					
					 The album consists of three chapters--invincible friendship established on anti-imperialist united front, great friendship formed under trust of leaders of DPRK and China and solid friendship sealed on road for common cause of socialism.

articles.title: Book "Aid to Liberation War in Northeast China" Published
articles.content:
Book "Aid to Liberation War in Northeast China" Published
						
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House of the DPRK has brought out a book "Aid to Liberation War in Northeast China".
					 The book deals with historical facts that President Kim Il Sung rendered material aid and moral support to the Chinese people in their liberation war in the latter half of the 1940s.
					
					 It also details the struggle of the Korean units which shed blood in the battles for the victory in the liberation war including operations in Changchun and Jinzhou along with Chinese comrades-in-arms, true to the instruction of the President on supporting the Chinese revolution.

articles.title: Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-China Diplomatic Relations Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-China Diplomatic Relations Observed
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK will as ever strive to steadily strengthen and develop the DPRK-China friendship.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an editorial article on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and China.
					
					 The establishment of the bilateral diplomatic relations on October 6, 1949 was an epochal event in developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean people actively helped the Chinese people in the anti-Japanese war and the civil war and the latter rendered material and moral support to the former in the last Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The peoples of the two countries have closely supported and cooperated with each other and strengthened solidarity in carrying out the common cause of socialist construction and peace against war.
					
					 The flower garden of the DPRK-China friendship was provided and cultivated by President Kim Il Sung and the leaders of the elder generation of China and it has been brought into fuller bloom generation after generation.
					
					 The peoples of the DPRK and China are pleased with the fact that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations are steadily growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The development of the DPRK-China friendship is contributing to accelerating socialist construction in the two countries and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over all the achievements made in China and wholeheartedly wish the Chinese people new progress and victory.
					
					 It is the common desire and will of the two parties and the two peoples to consolidate and develop the traditional bilateral friendship generation after generation.

articles.title: Foolish Remarks of Israeli Defence Minister Censured
articles.content:
Foolish Remarks of Israeli Defence Minister Censured 
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Israeli Minister of Defence Barak at a recent press conference let loose a spate of balderdash that the nuclear issue of Iran is not a threat to the existence of Israel and what requires primary attention is the "nuclear issue of north Korea." He cried out for escalating the pressure on the DPRK.
					 The minister of Defence Industry, Trade and Labor of Israel, too, complained that the U.S. reaction is low-toned despite "north Korea's continued provocation with missile launches".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is a cock-bull-story for Israel to assert that the DPRK located in the Far East poses a nuclear "threat" to Israel in the Middle East. As far as threat is concerned, it is the DPRK that should direct an accusing finger to Israel.
					
					 Citing facts to prove the military technological cooperation between Israel and south Korea now getting brisk, the commentary says:
					
					 It is preposterous for Israel to unreasonably vociferate about the "threat" from someone though it is threatening the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula with continued delivery of ultra modern military equipment to south Korea.
					
					 What Israel seeks in trumpeting about the non-existent "threat" from the DPRK is a sinister aim to placate the world public demanding stop to the construction of the Jewish "settlements" and opening to public of its nuclear program and realize its expansionist ambition through a monopoly of nuclear weapons in the Mideast region. 
					
					 The DPRK has invariably supported the just stand of the Arab countries striving for the denuclearization of the Mideast and opposed the policy of Israel to expand its territory contrary to peace.
					
					 The DPRK is doing all what it should do as a full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 Israel had better mind its own business, not pulling up others unnecessarily.

articles.title: Peculiar Scene
articles.content:
Peculiar Scene
Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il dropped in at a house of newly married couple of ex-soldiers while giving field guidance to the just constructed Wonsan Youth Power Station one day in January this year.
					 He asked them about their life in detail like their real father before riveting his eyes on balls of soybean malt hanging on a wall of the upper room.
					
					 With bright smile on his face, he stressed the balls of soybean malt represented a peculiar scene only to be seen in socialist rural dwellings.
					
					 He told the smell of soybean malt was nice, adding: It is sure that the housewife is versed in making soybean paste and sauce.
					
					 That day he had a picture taken with the couple and blessed their future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe telegrama de agradecimiento de Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe telegrama de agradecimiento de Wen Jiabao
						
Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Kim Yong Nam y el premier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Il, recibio el telegrama de agradecimiento remitido el dia 6 por Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China.
					La misiva sigue abajo:
					
					Yo y mi comitiva ya hemos concluido con exito nuestra visita oficial y de amistad a Corea, vecino amistoso.
					
					Antes de salir de Corea, quisiera expresar mi sincero agradecimiento por el trato hospitalario y la agenda trazada minuciosamente por ustedes.
					
					Durante la visita, nosotros vimos con nuestros propios ojos el hermoso paisaje de Corea y los exitos jubilosos del pueblo coreano alcanzados en la construccion socialista bajo la direccion del PTC encabezado por el Secretario General Kim Jong Il y pudimos sentirnos directamente del profundo sentimiento del pueblo coreano hacia el chino.
					
					A traves del franco y profundo entendimiento mutuo sobre las relaciones China-Corea y los problemas internacionales y regionales de interes mutuo, llegamos a  amplia cognicion comun.
					
					La presente visita profundizo aun mas la comprension mutua y la confianza entre ambas partes e impulso el intercambio y la cooperacion en diversas ramas de los dos paises.
					
					Consideramos con satisfaccion de los exitos logrados en la visita.
					
					Deseamos que la RPDC prospere y que el pueblo coreano goce de felicidad.
					
					Deseamos al camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el camarada presidente Kim Yong Nam y el camarada premier Kim Yong Il buena salud y exitos en sus labores.

articles.title: Wen Jiabao visita a la Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am
articles.content:
Wen Jiabao visita a la Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am
						
Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ATCC) -- Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, y su comitiva visitaron el dia 6 a la Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am de Amistad Corea-China en el municipio de Sun-an de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					Les acompanaron el vicecanciller coreano Kim Yong Il y el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su.
					
					Wen Jiabao escucho la explicacion de como esa localidad se convirtio magnificamente bajo la atencion calida de los grandes hombres sin par.
					
					Ademas, recorrio la casa visitada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung junto con el entonces premier chino Zhou Enlai, la sala de amistad Corea-China y el jardin de la infancia.
					
					El visitante chino dono medios de transporte a la granja.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang el premier chino
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang el premier chino
 Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ATCC) -- Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, se repatrio el dia 6 en un vuelo especial luego de realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a Corea cumplimentando la invitacion del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Regresaron junto con el el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi y otros acompanantes.
					
					  Los huespedes chinos fueron despedidos en el aeropuerto por el premier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC Kim Yong Il, el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion Ro Tu Chol, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del CC de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China Choe Chang Sik, el jefe del Secretariado del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Ho, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Pak Kyong Son, el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae y el embajador coreano acreditado en China Choe Jin Su.
					
					  Figuraban alli el embajador Liu Xiaoming y otros miembros de la embajada china en Corea, los huespedes chinos que permanecen en Corea y los estudiantes chinos.
					
					  En la terminal aerea se efectuo la ceremonia de despedida de Wen Jiabao.
					
					  El premier chino recibio los ramos de flores que le dieron una mujer de la embajada china y miembros de la Union de Ninos de Corea.
					
					  Este dia, el visitante fue objeto de despedida hospitalaria de los capitalinos a su paso por las avenidas de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Sera eterna la historia de amistad Corea-China, senala Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Sera eterna la historia de amistad Corea-China, senala Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tambien en el futuro al igual que en pasado, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano se esforzaran activamente por fortalecer incesantemente la amistad con China.
					  Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un articulo de Redaccion fechado 6 dedicado al 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas Corea-China.
					
					  El establecimiento el 6 de octubre de 1949 de tales relaciones sirvio del evento trascendental en el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre  ambos paises.
					
					  El pueblo coreano ayudo activamente la guerra antijaponesa y la interior del pueblo chino y este dio el apoyo espiritual y material a aquel en el periodo de la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					  Los pueblos coreano y chino han venido fortaleciendo la solidaridad apoyandose y cooperando estrechamente entre si en el cumplimiento de la causa comun por la construccion socialista y la paz antibelica.
					
					  La amistad Corea-China fue preparada y cultivada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y los dirigentes de la veterana generacion de China y florece mas hermosamente de siglo en siglo y de generacion en generacion.
					
					  Las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China se desarrollan sin cesar bajo la profunda atencion de los maximos dirigentes de ambos paises, lo cual da alegria a  ambos pueblos.
					
					  El fortalecimiento de la amistad Corea-China contribuye a acelerar la construccion socialista en los dos paises y preservar la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					  El pueblo coreano se regocija sinceramente de todos los exitos que se logran en China y desea de todo corazon al pueblo chino nuevo progreso y triunfo.
					
					  Consolidar generacion tras generacion la tradicional amistad Corea-China es el deseo y la voluntad comunes de los partidos y los pueblos de los dos paises.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de entidad china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de entidad china
  Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dirigiera el Buro General Estatal de Supervision, Control y Cuarentena de la Calidad de Productos de China.
					  El director general de este buro, Wang Yong, de visita en Corea, lo entrego a un funcionario coreano.
